content.description:
The bolted line just left of "Call An Arborist" has a defined crux up high. Shared anchor with that route.



Bolted line just left of the deep crack splitting the wall.

Bolts

Thin climbing that will feel hard if you're too far to the right. A good route for those thinking about trying friction climbs on the Apron such as "Slab Alley" or "Banana Peel" where trust in your shoes is a required prerequisite.



Left most line on the wall

Bolts

Start climbing the obvious crack splitting the wall. Straight up, past a couple horizontal cracks and a tricky move left past a bolt (climbing too high will feel harder). 2 more bolts and gear to the top. Shared anchor with "Bidding War".



The obvious deep crack splitting the wall

SR to 3"

Nice features through the slab lead to a thin crux at the 3rd bolt. Easier cracks above to the top.



3rd route from the right side of the wall

SR

An excellent novice multi-pitch crack climb with easy jamming, good gear, and fun movement.
p1- Follow the obvious crack for 34 meters to a big ledge
p2- Move belay 10m left to a bolted station at the base of the second pitch. Fun finger cracks climb past a couple horizontals to a ledge with unique views of the Chief.

Rappel twice with a 70m rope (you'll need to reverse the ledge walk in between rappels) or walk off south along the ridge to pick up main descent trail.

Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the crag.

SR to 3", 70m rope

Some may find extra cams in the #.75-2 helpful.

The right-most climb on the wall. Start up the crack and climb the long arête to a bolted anchor. A 60m rope just works, tie a knot in your rope.


Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the crag.

6 bolts + SR to 2"

Climb past two bolts to some easy, pleasant cracks up the rest of the wall. A thin friction move at the second bolt requires some trust in your shoes!



Two routes over from the deep crack of "Call an Arborist"

SR

Nice climbing though face features and small cracks leads to a tricky move at the 3rd bolt. More broken cracks and a bolt lead to the top. Shared anchor with "Blown Budget"



Second route from the right side of the wall

SR

The nice crackline to the left of "Condo Crack". Can be linked into that route, or finish at the independent station.



Just left of "Condo Crack" on the other side of the tree. 

SR

Climb easily up to a thin, bolted slab. Once above, take easier terrain up and left to a shared anchor with "Priced Out" 



Starts of the right edge of the highest belay platform. Two routes over from the obvious landmark of "Call an Arborist"

Bolts, SR

Excellent face climbing on beautiful stone.

Climb the short finger crack and mantle past a bolt. From the ledge, climb the steep headwall using crimpy pockets and seams in the smooth glacier polish. Move up and left over the bulge across an easier slab to the anchor. Save some finger-sized cams for after the last bolt.

Can be top-roped by climbing "The Groove Tube" and moving right past the mid-way anchor.

Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the Corner Unit area. Continue past it for 2 mins to reach the backside climbs.
Bolts, SR to BD#1. A couple extra finger-sized cams may be helpful.

Can be climbed as one long pitch (55m) with a few extra extendable draws.

P1- Climb the polished, featured slab to a ledge. Over a bulge, up "the groove" to a tricky move past a bolt. Move right to the anchor on a ledge if breaking up pitches.

P2- Continue up the handcrack until forced back right. Climb through some bulges to an anchor at the top of the wall. 2 rappels with a 60m get you back to the base.

Alternate pitch- From the P1 anchor, climb up right through a steppy hand crack and some slabby bulges. Move back left to the anchor. 5.7

Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the Corner Unit area. Continue past it for 2 mins to reach the backside climbs.
SR to 2", a few extra pieces and extendable draws if linking into one 55m pitch (recommended)

Takes the line of bolts up the steep, featured slab. at the 5th bolt, move left into the small dihedral system and a bolted anchor below the big ledge. A 60m rope just works from this station, tie a knot in the rope.


Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the crag.

Bolts+ SR to 2"

Climbs a direct line to the attractive handcrack. 3 bolts protect the moderate climbing to a ledge. from here, tricky slab climbing using pockets and dike holds gains the easy but fun crack. Pulling on the quickdraws at the crux brings the grade down into 5.10 A0 if you cant get your shoes to cooperate...

A variation moves left from the hand crack to gain a separate finger crack and keeps things a little more sustained. 

Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the Corner Unit area. Continue past it for 2 mins to reach the backside climbs.
Bolts, a few cams from #.75-2 for the crack

Climb past a bolt to the short hand crack. Bolts and gear lead up the nice featured wall above. 



One route left of the Down Payment crackline. 

6 bolts, SR

Friction climb past 4 bolts to some easier gear-protected moves. Face climbing up the steep wall past 3 more bolts leads to the anchor.

Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the Corner Unit area. Continue past it for 2 mins to reach the backside climbs.
Bolts, SR to 2"

Climb the lightning-bolt shaped crack to its top and an exciting move to a horizontal. Two bolts climb through awesome pockets to the top. Great climbing for the grade!



Starts to the right of the obvious crack line of "Call and Arborist"

SR

Climb the low-5th groove past a stump to a ledge. From here, move up left into a finger crack, avoiding the chimney. Be careful as rock quality in the chimney system is poor.

Alternatively, from the ledge, climb further left protected by a small but bomber TCU to reach the nice handcrack of "Just Wanna Jam", but at a more modest grade of 5.9-ish

Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the Corner Unit area. Continue past it for 2 mins to reach the backside climbs.
SR to 3" include a small 0.5" TCU (green c3 or equivalent)

Clip a bolt above the ledge and follow a short finger crack to its top. A small cam (green alien) protects moves above the first bolt. After this, bolts lead up the cool, pocketed slab above to a shared anchor with “Income Suite”. A 60m rope just works from this station, tie a knot in the rope.


Backside of the Papoose. Follow the main descent trail for 5 mins to an obvious left fork just below the crag.

Bolts, light rack to #1 including alien-style cams

A good test of your ability to believe in your shoe rubber comes at the 3rd bolt



Fully bolted line, black bolts

bolts

This new area holds lots of moderate pitches, ranging from a 2-pitch 5.6 crack up to 5.12a. Morning sun, afternoon shade. The backside has a great ambiance with the sound of Shannon Falls nearby, and no highway noise.

The “Corner Unit” area has long pitches, a 60m just works for some but a 70m is needed for Condo Crack. If you want to climb Condo Crack with a 60m, walk off along the ridge to gain the descent trail from the frontside climbs back to your gear at the base.

The backside has another 2-pitch 5.8 as well as some harder climbs 5.11-5.12. “Glacial Facial” is the standout pitch. “Baby Bum” 5.12d (Peter Croft roof crack) is just left of the “Groove Tube”.
